page.title: 09HISTORY OF BATTLE ABBEY
page.content: { BATTLE ABBEY}WAS FOUNDED BY{WILLIAM {THE CONQUEROR}AFTER HIS VICTORY AT THE BATTLE OF HASTINGS IN 1066,AND WAS CONSECRATED IN 1094.IT WAS COLONISED BY A GROUP OF{BENEDICTINE MONKS}FROM NORMANDY AND WAS FAVOURED BY ANGLO-NORMAN KINGS. THE CHURCH AND OTHER MONASTIC BUILDINGS WERE{REBUILT} IN THE LATE 13TH CENTURY.THE ABBEY WAS {DISSOLVED}UNDER HENRY VIII IN 1538. ALTHOUGH THE MONASTERY WAS VERY RICH, THERE WERE NEVER AS MANY MONKS AS WILLIAM HAD HOPED;THERE WAS SPACE FOR 140 BUT AT MOST THERE WERE 80 AND BY THE TIME IT WAS DISSOLVED,ONLY 7 WERE LEFT. THEN THE ABBEY WAS GIVEN TO{SIR ANTONY {BROWNE,}MASTER OF THE KING'S HORSE.HE DEMOLISHED THE CHURCH,CHAPTER HOUSE AND CLOISTERS AND TOOK OVER THE ABBOT'S HOUSE AS A FAMILY HOME.IN 1715 THE ESTATE WAS SOLD TO{SIR THOMAS
